[

Strategic Planner

Company Name Australian Radio Network Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 12 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Strategic Planner

We’re creating the future of audio entertainment. Exciting right? Want to help? Read on.

We’re looking for a Strategic Planner to help Energise Brands our brands and our client brands. Our brands include iHeartRadio, the KIIS and PURE GOLD Networks & The Edge 96.One. We do Radio, DAB+, Music Streaming, Podcasts, Digital, Mobile, Live Events, Activations, Partnerships...the list goes on. We interact with over 4 million people every week.

You’ll be supporting the Strategy team in providing meaningful insights and innovative strategy to drive market leading client solutions and in turn, revenue and growth for ARN.

The role consists of 2 equally important parts: First, providing insight and inspiration showing how we can commercialise creativity. Second, to provide validation, support and analysis for a buy, an idea or an execution. We’re looking for somebody agile and passionate, strategically curious and with a healthy level of optimistic cynicism.

The successful candidate will have;
  • Ideally, you’ll have 3-5 years’ experience in a media or integrated creative agency, client marketing team or media sales. You’ll have some understanding of the planning process and a good grasp of creative solutions.
  • You will have demonstrated your ability to develop and champion innovative communications solutions.
  • A convincing presenter, you’ll be able to influence what others think, feel and ultimately, do.
Key Responsibilities include:
  • Be Insightful. When creating marketing, be the voice of our listeners and represent their point of view.
  • Be Resourceful. Adopt and develop thinking tools and frameworks to use & share with Integration & Sales.
  • Be Thoughtful. You’ll want to research, write and share impactful thought pieces.
  • Be Teachers. Become the masters and educators of our research resources.
  • Be Accountable. Support our efforts to understand the effectiveness of what we do.
Benefits & Culture

The Key Benefits Include

People enjoy working at ARN (Australian Radio Network) because it’s a fun, fast paced dynamic culture. Importantly you’ll be part of a dynamic and supportive team in the world of media and entertainment. ARN is a HT&E company.
  • A bonus week of leave,
  • Paid parental leave,
  • Annual learning and development program including study leave and
  • Employee assistance program.
If this sounds like you, let your first action be to visit www.arn.com.au/careers page and upload your resume and a cover letter finishing the following statements by 25 September 2018:
  • If I was a type of energy I’d be…
  • I think the future of audio is…
  • The best thing I’ve seen this year is…
  • I think what sets me apart is…
You can find out more at www.arn.com.au or connect with us on LinkedIn (Linkedin /australianradionetwork)

819979292:
[

Senior SEO Manager

Company Name RateMyAgent Australia Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 67 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

YOUR PURPOSE


Due to the continued growth and success of the organisation, RateMyAgent have created an exciting opportunity for a talented SEO Manager to join a highly successful Melbourne Tech business with services in three differents countries and a digital footprint of over 30 million unique pages.


This is an excellent opportunity for a gifted SEO Manager to set the SEO strategy for the company and to work with the Product, Marketing and Delivery teams to execute. The SEO manager will also need to demonstrate an exceptional understanding of best practice and trends to help teams engrain SEO optimisation into everything that they do. This is a greenfields opportunity that needs a SEO manager capable of working in a fast paced multifaceted environment, who can maintain a strategic vision but also get their hands dirty when the situation requires it.


WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING.....

This is an exciting position where you can truly influence our organic search traffic. Day to day you can expect to:

  • Work closely with our Product and Marketing team to set the strategic direction of our organic search audience acquisition

  • Develop a clear understanding of our target audience and their search behaviours through the property cycle

  • Develop and implement class leading SEO strategies

  • Identify opportunities to grow organic traffic across any of RMA’s business activities

  • Work closely with delivery teams to document and apply SEO best practice

  • Create dashboards and reports to monitor our SEO performance

  • Monitor off site search engine ranking signals including links, social shares, citations and assess opportunities and threats

  • Work with internal teams to develop content based on business priorities, opportunities, input and direction


REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE


You can help us be the brand people think of when looking for an agent. To do this, we need someone who can demonstrate:

  • 5+ years SEO experience with demonstrable experience in significantly growing quality audiences

  • This role is hands on, like every role at RMA - you’ll need a ‘can do’ and ‘get it done’ mentality

  • An ability to think strategically, but get down and dirty when the situation requires

  • Experience with optimising a large scale website in multiple geographies

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills

  • Extremely numerate and data literate

  • Working to overcome different challenges

  • An understanding of HTML, CSS, web standards and SEO meta/schema tags

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills and comfort with large data sets

  • Experience in managing keywords across a company in multiple markets

  • Strong understanding of best SEO practices, search engine trends, and search engine algorithms

  • Expertise with Webmaster tools, and other SEO tools/platforms


DESIRABLE SKILLS & EXPERIENCE


  • Experience of multiple Agile methodologies beyond basic ceremonies, and communicating their techniques and value to others. The ability to lead story breakdowns, forecasting and planning, run meetings and can take on scrum master responsibilities when required

  • Some exposure to front end technologies (HTML, AngularJS, React Native, Grunt, Webpack, NPM)


BENEFITS

RateMyAgent offers a competitive salary, a fun and relaxed office space in Richmond, and a great team of colleagues to spend the day with. Education and career progression are highly prioritised to ensure people get the most out of their commitment to the business, with opportunities to innovate on a number of major developments across the company.

Public Sector Account Executive - Learning Solutions

LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers, and every day millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities and gain insights. Our global reach means we get to make a direct impact on the world's workforce in ways no other company can. We're much more than a digital resume; we transform lives through innovative products and technology.

Searching for your dream job? At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in changing the way the world works.

Linkedin Learning Solutions is seeking a Public Sector Hybrid Account Executive to sell it's Learning products and services to assigned government accounts. This is a position for an experienced Public Sector sales professional with a gift for closing sales, and the track record to prove it.

Responsibilities
  • Develop customer relationships that will yield long-term success
  • Work to maximise customer satisfaction before, during, and after the sale
  • Prepare presentations, proposals and sales contracts and present to prospects and customers
  • Prepare the appropriate paperwork to activate and maintain contract services
  • Prepare the required status reports, including activity, closings, follow-up, and adherence to goals

Basic Qualifications
  • 5+ years sales experience in a quota carrying sales role within the SaaS, Government or Learning and Development marketplace

Preferred Qualifications
  • Demonstrated success as a self-starter
  • Problem-solving skills and adaptability to the rapidly-changing requirements of the business
  • A collaborative team player with excellent listening, presentation and negotiation skills
  • Experience with Microsoft Office and Salesforce.com a plus
  • Achieve or exceed sales quota through prospecting, building and developing a pipeline and closing sales with State & Local Government customers

Development Manager

Company Name The GPT Group Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 377 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Do you want to work for a Top 50 ASX listed business that is transforming the property market of Australia?

At GPT we are passionate about creating spaces that go beyond the expectations of our investors, customers and communities. We create value through our focus on strategic investment and management of high quality shopping centres, office towers, logistics centres and business parks and proudly own a number of prime assets across Australia. Every day we strive to deliver expectational results to achieve our vision to be the most respected property company in Australia. We do this by empowering our people to take initiative and create solutions.

An opportunity has arisen for a Development Manager to join our reputable Melbourne Development team. In light of recent projects you will ideally demonstrate experience in commercial office development and will also be responsible for working across retail & mixed developments.

Key responsibilities of your role will include;

  • Detailing a masterplan strategy within a specified program to maximise returns and minimise risk for an asset commensurate with economic, social and environmental objectives.
  • Managing the team, interface with other teams.
  • Business planning, physical planning, a well-developed consensus and approval processes to deliver the outputs.
  • Identification of risks and barriers to delivery of opportunities.
  • Preparation of funding requirements to progress resolution of development opportunities.
  • Developing the economic, social, environmental and risk management frameworks for identified development opportunities through a progressive definition process that manages risk to an appropriate level, allowing commencement of project delivery.
  • Managing the project team environment to optimise the opportunities for value creation until project delivery completion.
  • Working with appropriate partners.
  • Formulating the required approval request documentation.
  • Managing the progressive value optimisation, consensus and approval processes for the proposal

What will make you stand out?

To make you stand out from the crowd your skills and experience will ideally meet the below selection criteria.

  • A minimum of 3 +years’ experience in property development ideally in retail or office.
  • Tertiary education in a relevant field.
  • Project management skills required.
  • Project marketing and Leasing management experience required.
  • Retail development experience required.
  • Valuation skills desirable.
  • High level of financial acumen
  • Demonstrate strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to formulate a strategy to capture the market opportunity
  • Ability to manage the asset and development management process
  • High attention to detail and ability to work within tight deadlines.

What makes us stand out?

  • Awarded Employer of Choice 2018
  • Commitment to diversity and inclusion
  • Broad spectrum of diverse and challenging career opportunities available across the organisation
  • Investment in your personal development and future career aspirations
  • Flexible work options available to all GPT employees
  • Competitive remuneration packages and employee benefits

We recognise that providing our people with flexible working options improves our performance, supports wellbeing and improves our lives outside of work. Our mobile workplace technologies and activity based work environments make working at GPT what you do, not where you do it. Explore your options to achieve flexibility including: generous paid parental leave, tailored hours and flexible scheduling, career breaks, study leave, compressed hours, remote working and leave purchase plans.

What are the next steps?

If the above sounds like out then we’d love to hear from you! Click the below link to submit your formal application online and a member of the talent team will be in touch.

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 108 views

Job description

  • Senior Organisational Development Lead
  • Newly Created Role
  • Up to $200,000 package


As a major player in the financial services sector, this organisation is undergoing substantial growth and transformational change. The Organisational Development Lead will be responsible for leading the business through this exciting time.

Based in the CBD, this newly created role will be working specifically across various organisational initiatives and programs including capability, performance management, talent management, leadership development, employee engagement and transformation/change management. This role will be expected to provide strategic advice, thought leadership and translate functional needs into pragmatic, cost effective OD initiatives and solutions that deliver a return to the business.

This role will suit an experienced organisational development consultant who is creative and who can demonstrate the ability to develop an organisational development strategy in line with corporate strategy, experience in leading, motivating and developing employees and a demonstrated ability to lead, promote, embed and facilitate change/transformation strategies and initiatives.

Additionally, you will have proven experience and capability in project and stakeholder management and expertise in the delivery of culture/engagement programs

The successful candidate will have highly developed written and verbal communication skills including the ability to influence at a senior management level and an ability to build and maintain effective relationships and build partnerships with internal and external stakeholders.

This is a fabulous opportunity to be part of an organisation that undergoing significant growth and transformation. You will be part of team who are driven, high performing and pride themselves on supporting the business through strategic initiatives.

To learn more about this opportunity please call Michelle Collins on 9008 5839 for a confidential discussion.


If this great opportunity interests you, please apply today and attach your resume (Word preferred).
